parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided text.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. While the post is by a politician, Daniela Onița-Ivașcu, it does not explicitly mention or promote any specific parliamentary candidate.  The post focuses on general reflections on the first round of presidential elections and the importance of respecting democratic processes. It does not advocate for or against any particular candidate in the parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a public Facebook post, paid for and intended to reach a wide audience. The language used ("Oameni buni," "Lecția rezultatelor alegerilor," etc.) indicates an address to the general public.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post appears to be to express opinions on the democratic process and the results of the presidential elections. While the author is a politician, the content itself does not directly advocate for or against any candidate in the parliamentary elections. The call for respect for democratic processes and condemnation of negative political behaviors is not inherently electoral propaganda.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Partially True. The post presents an opinion piece on the outcome of the presidential elections and the need for better democratic practices. It could be considered a form of citizen journalism, expressing a political opinion. However, the lack of factual reporting and the focus on personal reflection rather than objective analysis weakens this aspect.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>True. The post largely expresses personal opinions and reflections on the presidential election results and the state of Romanian politics. While the author is a politician, the content is presented as a personal reflection rather than a campaign message.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>550578607779672</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post by Daniela Onița-Ivașcu does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  While the author is a politician and the post is paid for, the content focuses on general reflections on the presidential elections and the importance of democratic principles. It does not directly promote or oppose any candidate in the parliamentary elections. The post lacks the key elements of electoral propaganda as defined in Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006: it does not directly refer to a specific parliamentary candidate, its objective is not to influence the vote in the parliamentary elections, and it does not exceed the limits of expressing a political opinion.  The post's focus is on broader issues of democratic conduct and accountability, not on swaying votes for a particular candidate.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
